member.name: T:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.ApplicationEventManager
member.summary: The EventManager Class provides functions to broadcast user-defined event.

member.name: M:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.ApplicationEventManager.Publish(System.String,Tizen.Applications.Bundle)
member.summary: Sends the User-Event to receiver applications.
member.remarks: The format of User-Event's name MUST be "event.{sender's appid}.{user-defined name}", refer to 'The name-format of User-Event' section, If the event_name is invalid, throw InvalidOperationException
member.exception: Thrown in case of an invalid parameter.
Thrown in case of any internal error.

member.name: M:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.ApplicationEventManager.Publish(System.String,Tizen.Applications.Bundle,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends the User-Event to trusted receiver-applications.
member.param: Whether the event is trusted or not.
member.remarks: The application which has same certification with sender can receive the event. The format of User-Event's name MUST be "event.{sender's appid}.{user-defined name}", refer to 'The name-format of User-Event' section, If the event_name is invalid, throw InvalidOperationException
member.exception: Thrown in case of an invalid parameter.
Thrown in case of any internal error.

member.name: M:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.ApplicationEventManager.KeepLastEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Keeps last User-Event data for receiver applications.
member.remarks: The receiver applications will receive this last event data after adding their new handlers via ApplicationEventReceiver since the sender application called this method. If a sender application sends same event via trusted method and non-trusted method, then a trusted receiver will get latest data regardless of trusted or non-trusted, but non-trusted receiver will get the last data only from non-trusted method. The effect of this API continues during runtime. That means when the sender application process restarts, the sender application needs to call this api again to make the event to keep the last event.
member.exception: Thrown in case of an invalid parameter.
Thrown in case of any internal error.

member.name: T:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.EventManagerEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments for the event raised when the application event is received

member.name: P:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.EventManagerEventArgs.Name
member.summary: The Name of the event.

member.name: P:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.EventManagerEventArgs.Data
member.summary: The event data of the application event.

member.name: T:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.EventReceiver
member.summary: The ApplicationEventReceiver Class provides functions to add event handler.

member.name: M:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.EventReceiver.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializer of class.

member.name: M:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.EventReceiver.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizer of class.

member.name: P:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.EventReceiver.EventName
member.summary: Gets the eventname.

member.name: E:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.EventReceiver.Received
member.summary: Occurs when events are received.
member.remarks: If you want to add the privileged event, you MUST declare right privilege first. Unless that, throw UnauthorizedAccessException. The privileged events are commented on remarks of it's definitions.

member.name: M:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.EventReceiver.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases any unmanaged resources used by this object. Can also dispose any other disposable objects.
member.param: If true, disposes any disposable objects. If false, does not dispose disposable objects.

member.name: M:Tizen.Applications.EventManager.EventReceiver.Dispose
member.summary: Release all the resources used by the class.
